group_1.narration: I'm meeting my brother today,@so could you wait in the lobby for me?
To tell you the truth, I am thinking of telling him@about you and all the Magical Girls again,@since as long as Touka remains a Magical Girl,@my brother will also be involved.
What I am about to tell my brother here@I will tell you later as well, Nayuta,@so I would like you to try to prepare yourself.

group_1.textLeft: Prepare...@I feel uneasy all of a sudden...

group_1.narration: What kind of reaction will Nayuta have?@Will she stubbornly judge us?@Or will she join us...?
Either way, it is as if I tricked her into living with me.
I didn't want the professor's daughter@to know of his negative ego,@so I refrained from putting a stop@to her search for her father,
but I refused to stick my neck out for her,@I prevented her from getting to the heart of the matter,@and I didn't tell her where the professor was.
It would be strange of her to not hate me...
Maybe it's because we have been together so long.@The thought of her hating me shocks me greatly...@But Nayuta, I'm sure,@will be much more shocked than I...

Everything in this world is indistinguishable.@I am me, I am not me.@One is all, all is one.@If the boundaries of words@are completely devoid of all meaning,@we lose all pain and comfort, and become nothing.
It's as if the shock is gone.

group_1.textLeft: He is taking much too long!

group_1.textRight: It does appear to be way beyond our scheduled time.
I only wanted to say hello.

group_1.textLeft: I cannot wait any longer.@I will be back shortly.

group_1.textCenter: If you charge in without an appointment,@they will just turn you away...
Taking however many hours it has been,@this is far too strange.
Uncle would never have this much time@to begin with.
Papa already finished with his business and left...?

group_1.narration: Yes, I listened to his little fantasy story@because it involved my daughter,@but it's really strange...
For the time being,@I don't want him flapping his mouth@and bringing more shame around here,@so I'm having him cool his head off.@It would be more of a problem@if he went off hiding again.
Confinement is bad for his reputation.@He's waiting for me to finish my work.@He wants to try convincing me more.
Besides,@as long as there's fear of confusing the public,@I will have to eventually come out to the public@to explain it from a scientific point of view.
Yes, we can discuss the details over dinner later.

group_1.textCenter: (Why? Just to deny Papa's story again...?)

group_1.textRight: Hey, what is that girl doing there!?
